title: Learning Path: Multiplayer replication lag
ai_summary: The user is experiencing noticeable delays in multiplayer games due to network replication.
ai_what_you_learn: Understand the difference between client-side prediction and server authoritative replication.
Use Unreal Insights (available in the Engine) to profile network traffic and identify bottlenecks.
Optimize replicated properties by reducing the frequency of updates or using conditional replication.
Implement techniques like lag compensation or dead reckoning to smooth out perceived latency.

steps.title: Step 1: Understand Network Fundamentals
steps.description:
Before troubleshooting, you need a solid grasp of how Unreal Engine handles multiplayer networking. This will help you understand the root causes of replication lag.

👉 **Action:** Watch the video to learn about the core networking concepts and how Unreal Engine is designed for multiplayer.
steps.action: Watch the video to learn about the core networking concepts and how Unreal Engine is designed for multiplayer.

content.title: Network Multiplayer Fundamentals | Live from HQ | Inside Unreal
content.description:
**Why this helps:** This video provides a fundamental overview of Unreal Engine's multiplayer framework. It will explain the basics of client-server architecture, replication, and how the engine is designed to handle networked games.

⏱️ **When to watch:** Start from the beginning to understand the fundamentals, and pay close attention to the sections on Actors, Components, and Replication. (20 minutes)

steps.title: Step 2: Diagnose Your Replication Issues
steps.description:
Identify where the lag is originating. Is it due to too much data being replicated, inefficient replication, or network conditions?

👉 **Action:** Learn about the Replication Graph and see if it can help isolate the source of your replication issues.
steps.action: Learn about the Replication Graph and see if it can help isolate the source of your replication issues.

content.title: Networking in 4.20: The Replication Graph | Feature Highlight | Unreal Engine Livestream
content.description:
**Why this helps:** This video introduces the Replication Graph, which is a powerful tool for optimizing network replication, especially in games with many players. It helps reduce the amount of data being sent over the network.

⏱️ **When to watch:** Focus on the sections explaining how the Replication Graph works and how to configure it for different types of actors. Look for examples of how to optimize replication for specific scenarios. (15 minutes)

steps.title: Step 3: Apply the Fix
steps.description:
Once you've identified the cause, implement solutions such as optimizing replicated variables, using conditional replication, or employing client-side prediction.

👉 **Action:** Watch the first video to understand the new replication system. While it's a future feature, it gives context for where replication is headed, and some concepts might be applicable now.
steps.action: Watch the first video to understand the new replication system. While it's a future feature, it gives context for where replication is headed, and some concepts might be applicable now.

content.title: Developing and Launching a New Replication System | Unreal Fest Orlando 2025
content.description:
**Why this helps:** This video covers the Iris replication system, which is a new approach to network replication designed to improve performance and scalability. While it's a future feature, understanding its design principles can inform your current optimization efforts.

⏱️ **When to watch:** Focus on the sections discussing the design goals of Iris and how it addresses common replication challenges. Pay attention to any mentions of optimizing data transfer and reducing network overhead. (10 minutes)

steps.title: Step 4: Prevent Future Issues
steps.description:
Adopt best practices from the start of your project. Plan your network architecture with scalability and performance in mind.

👉 **Action:** While not directly about replication lag, the Fog of War video highlights the importance of server-side authority and preventing cheating. Consider the implications of client-side vs server-side logic in the context of replication.

content.title: Server-Side Fog of War: Defending Against Wall Hacks | Unreal Fest Stockholm 2025
content.description:
**Why this helps:** Although focused on Fog of War, this video emphasizes the importance of server-side authority and preventing cheating. Thinking about what *doesn't* need to be replicated to the client, and keeping logic on the server, can reduce replication load.

⏱️ **When to watch:** Focus on the general principles of server-side authority and how it impacts client-server communication. Consider how these principles can be applied to other aspects of your game to minimize replication. (5 minutes)
